result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Griger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: After 6 months of serving Probation, defendant may petition the court for early termination upon all fines/costs/restitution being paid.

miscConds.notes: $200.00 restitution and surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation. $30.00 to J. Patrick and $170.00 to Pawn America.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael A Griger in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not wish to have counsel and would like to plea to the matter. Court adjourns the matter for 2 weeks to give the defendant time to speak with the DA and try to resolve the matter.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Michael A Griger in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
